column4: normally you download software and install it from the /tmp dir?
installation doesn't seem to go correctly
why does linux always put downloaded stuff in /tmp?
use windows or linux and wine
how are you trying to install software?
when you use ubuntu which extension fits?
i'd suggest to download that Debian package and do a "dpkg -i glGo-1.4.deb" as stated in instructions :)
Debian packages should work fine since Ubuntu is Debian based.
but what in general is the best directory to install programs for?
download it anywhere you want, i'd prefer your home directory.
it installs it automatically where it should, you don't have to worry anything.
dpkg and/or the program you install takes care of all that stuff.

just to clear out, you can find most of the software you need from Ubuntu repositories (http://packages.ubuntu.com/), they're all ready-to-go packages to install with "sudo apt-get install programname" like "sudo apt-get install planetpenguin". If you prefer to use GUI (Graphical User Interface, not command line), Synaptic does the job like apt-get in command line.
